meanings.definition: To mix (a solid substance) with a liquid to form a smooth mixture.
meanings.sent1: She slurried the flour and water to make pancake batter.
meanings.sent2: The chef slurried the ingredients to create a delicious sauce.
meanings.sent3: The kids slurried paint and glitter to make a messy masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: The artist slurried colors on the canvas, creating a beautiful blend.
meanings.sent5: The cement was slurried with water to form a strong foundation.

meanings.sent1: He slurried his words when he had too much to drink.
meanings.sent2: The tired professor slurried his lecture towards the end of the day.
meanings.sent3: The comedian intentionally slurried his punchline for comedic effect.
meanings.sent4: The radio host slurried the news, making it hard to understand.
meanings.sent5: The actor slurried his lines, causing confusion on stage.
